subject: Fashion
title: Roman Toga as Political Symbol
description: Learn Roman Toga as Political Symbol in one minute.

hook.text: Romans could be arrested for wearing the wrong toga. Clothing wasn't styleâ€”it was law.

buildup.text: The toga was a massive wool drape, 18 feet long, worn only by male Roman citizens.

discovery.text: A purple-bordered toga marked senators. An all-white toga meant you were running for office.

twist.text: Slaves and foreigners were banned from wearing togas. It was citizenship you could see.

climax.text: When Rome fell, so did the toga. Practicality replaced the empire's heaviest status symbol.

punchline.text: The toga was a passport you wore on your back.

quiz.question: What did the Roman toga primarily signify?
options: Citizenship and social rank, enforced by law
